value.product_title: Meet IntelliReader – streamlined access for common areas
value.product_intro: Manage access to lobbies, amenity spaces, and facilities with this sleek, wall-mounted reader. Supporting PIN codes, mobile keys, and RFID, IntelliReader integrates seamlessly with your property's access control system while handling high-traffic areas that don't need physical locks.

standard_doors.standard_intro: IntelliReader works with most common access systems and credentials:

standard_items.item_text: RFID cards: 13.56 MHz (MIFARE Classic, Ultralight, DESFire)

standard_doors.standard_conclusion: IntelliReader's versatile relay outputs can control virtually any electric door hardware, with simple configuration via our management platform.

specialty_doors.specialty_intro: IntelliReader also supports these more specialized systems:
specialty_doors.specialty_tip: For complex integrations like elevator control or multi-door interlocks, contact our solutions team for implementation guidance and wiring diagrams.

not_compatible.not_compatible_intro: IntelliReader is not designed for the following:

not_compatible_items.item_text: Direct replacement of mechanical locks (no physical locking mechanism)
Systems requiring fail-secure operation without backup power
Doors without nearby power source (no battery operation)
Legacy Wiegand systems using non-standard data formats

not_compatible.not_compatible_tip: If you need a standalone smart lock with integrated mechanical locking, consider our IntelliMortise, IntelliLever, or IntelliBolt products instead.

installation_steps.step_description: Determine optimal reader location near the door (typically 48" from floor). Ensure power is available at the installation site (12-24V DC required). Plan wire routes to electric strike or magnetic lock.
installation_steps.step_tip: We recommend using a multi-conductor cable (minimum 18 AWG) with sufficient wires for power, ground, and relay connections.

installation_steps.step_description: Remove the backplate from the reader. Use it as a template to mark mounting holes. Drill holes for anchors if mounting to drywall. Thread the connection wires through the central opening and secure the backplate with provided screws.

Connect power wires to the marked terminals (observe polarity). Connect the relay output wires to your electric strike, magnetic lock, or door operator according to the wiring diagram. Apply electrical tape to all connections.
installation_steps.step_tip: For magnetic locks (fail-safe), use the NC contact. For electric strikes (fail-secure), use the NO contact. Refer to the included wiring diagrams for detailed instructions.

installation_steps.step_description: Carefully align the reader with the backplate and snap it into place. Secure with the bottom security screw using the provided special tool. Test power by confirming the reader's keypad illuminates.

Connect the reader to Wi-Fi using the 33Lock mobile app. Configure relay timing, access credentials, and other settings through the management interface. Test operation by verifying the door unlocks with valid credentials.
installation_steps.step_tip: For optimal performance, conduct a signal strength test for WiFi at the installation location before final mounting.

testimonials.testimonial_text: We installed IntelliReaders at all our common area access points—gym, pool, roof deck, and main entrance. The unified platform means our residents can use the same credentials everywhere, and we've dramatically reduced key management headaches and security risks from lost cards.

The ability to instantly provide or revoke access has transformed our operation. When we have maintenance contractors on site, we can grant temporary PIN codes that automatically expire. The detailed logs let us know exactly who accessed what areas and when.

What impressed me most was the easy integration with our existing door hardware. We kept our magnetic locks and simply replaced the old keypads with IntelliReaders. The sleek design gets compliments from visitors, and the cloud management is intuitive even for our less tech-savvy staff.

faqs.question: Can IntelliReader control multiple doors or access points?
faqs.answer: Yes, IntelliReader has two independent relay outputs that can control separate doors or devices. For example, one reader could control both a vehicle gate and a pedestrian gate, or both the exterior door and an interior door of an airlock/mantrap configuration. For more complex multi-door scenarios, multiple readers can be networked together and managed from the same interface.

faqs.question: What happens during a power outage?
faqs.answer: IntelliReader requires constant power to operate, but your access system's fail state depends on the type of locks used. Magnetic locks (fail-safe) will unlock during power loss, while electric strikes (fail-secure) will remain locked. For critical applications, we recommend connecting to a battery backup or UPS to maintain operation during power outages. The reader itself has a memory backup that retains all access credentials and settings regardless of power status.

faqs.question: Is IntelliReader suitable for outdoor installation?
faqs.answer: Yes, IntelliReader has an IP66 rating which means it's dust-tight and protected against powerful water jets. It's suitable for installation in covered outdoor locations or areas exposed to weather. For extreme environments or direct exposure to heavy rain and snow, we recommend installing under an overhang or using our optional weather shield accessory to extend service life.

faqs.question: Can I use my existing access cards or fobs?
faqs.answer: IntelliReader is compatible with 13.56 MHz MIFARE format cards and fobs (including Classic, Ultralight, and DESFire). If you're currently using this format, your credentials will likely work. The reader is not compatible with 125 kHz proximity formats (like HID ProxCard or EM4100). We offer a credential migration service to help properties transition from older systems, including options to support dual-format credentials during the transition period.

faqs.question: How does IntelliReader integrate with our property management system?
faqs.answer: IntelliReader uses the same cloud platform as all 33Lock products, offering several integration options: 1) Direct API integration with major PMS platforms like Mews, Cloudbeds, and RMS, 2) Middleware integration through hospitality specialists like Operto, ASSA ABLOY, or RemoteLock, 3) Custom API integration using our developer documentation. The system can automatically assign and revoke credentials based on reservations, check-ins/check-outs, and other PMS events.
